title: Deferred Prosecution and Court Supervision Statistics

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Statistics on charges, breakdown of specific charges, and whether deferred prosecution or court supervision was offered from 2011 to August 2025.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

FOIA Chicago

title: Communications Regarding SCREEN/KOSA Acts and Foreign NGO Influence

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

from January 1, 2022, to present concerning:

1.The Kids Online Safety Act (KOSA) and/or the SCREEN Act, including internal drafts, reviews, or recommendations.

2.Communications, emails, meeting logs, or policy submissions involving:
- a) National Center on Sexual Exploitation (NCOSE)
- b) Collective Shout
- c) CEASE (Centre to End All Sexual Exploitation)
- d) Carnegie UK Trust
- e) Yoti (digital ID software provider)

3.Discussions regarding age verification systems, child internet safety standards, or external digital identity technologies.

This request is submitted with reference to the July 25, 2025 Interim Staff Report of the U.S. House Judiciary Committee titled:
“The Foreign Censorship Threat: How the European Union’s Digital Services Act Compels Global Censorship and Infringes on American Free Speech.”

This report documents concerns that foreign laws are being used to impose domestic censorship goals through indirect means. This FOIA request seeks to determine whether similar tactics were employed by the aforementioned NGOs or agencies.

I request a waiver of fees as this is a matter of significant public interest. I am submitting this on behalf of Alathea LLC.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Demosthenes Alathea

title: NGO and Foreign Regulator Influence on Online Safety Policy

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

dated January 1, 2022 to present regarding:

1.Internal discussions, communications, or meeting notes about:
- a) The SCREEN Act, KOSA, or age verification policies
- b) Digital ID systems proposed or discussed for minors online

2.Any correspondence with:
- a) National Center on Sexual Exploitation (NCOSE)
- b) Collective Shout
- c) CEASE (Centre to End All Sexual Exploitation)
- d) Carnegie UK Trust
- e) Yoti (digital ID software provider)

3.Records involving foreign regulators (e.g., Ofcom, EU Commission) discussing compliance enforcement or regulatory pressure on U.S. tech platforms.

This request is submitted with reference to the July 25, 2025 Interim Staff Report of the U.S. House Judiciary Committee titled:
“The Foreign Censorship Threat: How the European Union’s Digital Services Act Compels Global Censorship and Infringes on American Free Speech.”

This report documents concerns that foreign laws are being used to impose domestic censorship goals through indirect means. This FOIA request seeks to determine whether similar tactics were employed by the aforementioned NGOs or agencies.

I request a waiver of fees as this is a matter of significant public interest. I am submitting this on behalf of Alathea LLC.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Demosthenes Alathea

title: Communications Involving the Kids Online Safety Act, SCREEN Act, and Foreign NGO Policy Influence

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the DC Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all records from January 1, 2022, to the present, including but not limited to:

1.Communications, internal memoranda, policy drafts, meeting notes, or advisories related to:
- a)The Kids Online Safety Act (KOSA)
- b)The SCREEN Act
- c)Any U.S. age verification or online child safety policy proposals.

2.Communications or documents involving the following organizations:
- a)National Center on Sexual Exploitation (NCOSE)
- b)Collective Shout
- c)CEASE (Centre to End All Sexual Exploitation)
- d)Carnegie UK Trust
- e)Yoti (digital ID software provider)

3.Any communications with or internal responses to foreign regulators (e.g., Ofcom, European Commission) related to:
- a)The Online Safety Act (UK)
- b)The Digital Services Act (DSA) (EU)
- c)Impacts on U.S. tech companies or policymaking.

This request is submitted with reference to the July 25, 2025 Interim Staff Report of the U.S. House Judiciary Committee titled:
“The Foreign Censorship Threat: How the European Union’s Digital Services Act Compels Global Censorship and Infringes on American Free Speech.”

This report documents concerns that foreign laws are being used to impose domestic censorship goals through indirect means. This FOIA request seeks to determine whether similar tactics were employed by the aforementioned NGOs or agencies.

I request a waiver of fees as this is in the public interest. I am submitting this on behalf of Alathea LLC.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Demosthenes Alathea
